content.title: Intro
content.content:
1963
Preceded by
1963
1964
Year
1965
Followed by
1965
You may also be looking for Third Age 1964.

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1964.

content.title: January
content.content:
First or second week: J.R.R. Tolkien invites Walter Hooper to his house. They talk mostly about C.S. Lewis, who recently had died.[1]
9 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 254.
10 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to the Royal Society of Literature.
17 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Mrs. A. Mountfield.
18 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Justin Arundale.
20 - The 1965 BBC Interview with J.R.R. Tolkien is made.
20 - J.R.R. Tolkien starts writing a letter to Professor Przemyslaw Mroczkowski.
26 - J.R.R. Tolkien finishes writing a letter to Professor Przemyslaw Mroczkowski.

content.title: March
content.content:
5 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Eileen Elgar (of which a part was published as letter 255) and encloses the manuscripts Concerning ... 'The Hoard' and Kinship of the Half-elven.
16 - Artist Quinton Hoover is born.

content.title: April
content.content:
? - I, Palantir, issue 3 is published.
20 - Actor Andy Serkis is born.

content.title: May
content.content:
13 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 256.
28 - Tree and Leaf is first published in the UK.
30 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a Letter to Jane T. Sibley

content.title: June
content.content:
6 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Sue Parman.
7 - Actor Brian Talbot is born.
13-15 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a a letter to W.R. Matthews.

content.title: July
content.content:
10 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Alan White.
15 - J.R.R. Tolkien sends a letter to Miss J.L. Curry.
16 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 257.
? - L. Sprague de Camp sends Tolkien a copy of his anthology Swords & Sorcery.

content.title: August
content.content:
2 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 258.
7 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 259.
10 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Carole Ward.
16 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 260.
30 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 261.
30 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to L. Sprague de Camp.

content.title: September
content.content:
1 - J.R.R. Tolkien met Clyde S. Kilby
7 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 262.
10 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 263.
11 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 264.
30 - Actor Bernard Rebel dies.

content.title: October
content.content:
9 - Guillermo del Toro, co-writer of the upcoming The Hobbit duology, is born.
10 - The first episode of the Princess-serialization of The Hobbit is published.
10 - Actor Quinton Flynn is born.
17 - The second episode of the Princess-serialization of The Hobbit is published.
24 - The third episode of the Princess-serialization of The Hobbit is published.
31 - The fourth episode of the Princess-serialization of The Hobbit is published.

content.title: November
content.content:
1 - Actor Daran Norris is born.
7 - The fifth episode of the Princess-serialization of The Hobbit is published.
11 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 265.
11 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Clyde S. Kilby.
14 - The sixth episode of the Princess-serialization of The Hobbit is published.
21 - The seventh episode of the Princess-serialization of The Hobbit is published.
24 - Robert Graves, Oxford's Professor of Poetry, introduces J.R.R. Tolkien to Ava Gardner. They had never heard of one another, and both did not know why the other was famous.
26 - The 1964 BBC Interview with J.R.R. Tolkien was made.
28 - The eighth episode of the Princess-serialization of The Hobbit is published.
30 - El hobito, the first translation into Spanish of The Hobbit, is published.

content.title: December
content.content:
5 - The ninth episode of the Princess-serialization of The Hobbit is published.
12 - The tenth episode of the Princess-serialization of The Hobbit is published.
19 - The eleventh episode of the Princess-serialization of The Hobbit is published.
26 - The twelfth episode of the Princess-serialization of The Hobbit is published.
31 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Ingeborg Korff and her pupils.

? - J.R.R. Tolkien writes the essay "The Ulsterior Motive".
? - Author Chris Smith is born.

content.title: References
content.content:
